content.text:
# List of Paraguayan submissions for the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film

Paraguay submitted a film for the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film}} for the first time in 2015. The award is handed out annually by the United States Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences to a feature-length motion picture produced outside the United States that contains primarily non-English dialogue. It was not created until the 1956 Academy Awards, in which a competitive Academy Award of Merit, known as the Best Foreign Language Film Award, was created for non-English speaking films, and has been given annually since.
As of 2025, Paraguay has submitted nine films, but none of them were nominated.
Submissions
The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences has invited the film industries of various countries to submit their best film for the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film since 1956. The Foreign Language Film Award Committee oversees the process and reviews all the submitted films. Following this, they vote via secret ballot to determine the five nominees for the award.
Below is a list of the films that have been submitted by Paraguay for review by the Academy for the award by year and the respective Academy Awards ceremony.

Shortlisted Films
Since 2017, Paraguay has occasionally announced a list of all officially submitted films before announcing its official Oscar nominee. The following films have been submitted to the Paraguayan Film Academy:
